bibliographic-data.invention-title: Apparatus for positioning a patient-support deck

abstract.p: "APARELHO DE SUPORTE DE PACIENTE". Um aparelho de suporte de paciente (10) inclui uma base (12), uma superestrutura de suporte do paciente (14), com um comprimento longitudinal e uma largura transversal, e uma unidade de posicionamento da superestrutura (16), que acopla a superestrutura de suporte do paciente (14) à base (12). A superestrutura de suporte do paciente (16) é suportada, em relação à unidade de posicionamento da superestrutura (16), para movimento longitudinal. A unidade de posicionamento da superestrutura (16) inclui um atuador (76), com uma primeira região (78) e uma segunda região (80) que se move transversalmente, em relação à primeira região (78).

A unidade de posicionamento da superestrutura (16) inclui uma unidade de transmissão (82), configurada para transformar movimento transversal da segunda região (80), em relação à primeira região (78), em movimento longitudinal da superestrutura de suporte do paciente (14), em relação à base (12).

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Leito, e, aparelho de administração de linha configurado para ser acoplado a uma superfìcie de suporte para paciente para encaminhar linhas médicas e mangueiras.

abstract.p: "LEITO, E, APARELHO DE ADMINISTRAçãO DE LINHA CONFIGURADO PARA SER ACOPLADO A UMA SUPERFìCIE DE SUPORTE PARA PACIENTE PARA ENCAMINHAR LINHAS MéDICAS E MANGUEIRAS". Um leito (10) inclui uma base (12) e um conjunto suporte (22) acoplado à base (12). O conjunto suporte inclui primeiro e segundo braços suporte (42, 44) localizados acima da base (12). O leito (10) também inclui uma pluralidade de mecanismos de travamento (70, 72, 74) acoplados aos primeiro e segundo braços suporte (42, 44) e uma superfície de suporte para paciente (50) configurada para ser acoplada aos primeiro e segundo braços suporte (42, 44) por meio da pluralidade de mecanismos de travamento (70, 72, 74).

A superfície de suporte para paciente (50) é removível dos primeiro e segundo braços suporte (42, 44) para permitir a transferência de um paciente para e do leito (10) sobre a superfície de suporteo para paciente (50).

"APARELHO PARA AQUECER UM PACIENTE". Um aparelho para aquecer um paciente inclui uma superfície suporte para paciente 26 que tem uma cobertura externa 74 configurada para contatar o paciente, com um tecido eletricamente condutor 70 localizado dentro da cobertura, e um controlador acoplado eletricamente ao tecido condutor para aquecer o tecido eletricamente condutor até um nível selecionado.

A surgical support apparatus (10) includes a mobile support station (12) configured to receive medical equipment thereon. The mobile support station (12) includes at least one gas outlet (52) and at least one electrical outlet (50) for supplying gas and electricity to an operating room. The apparatus (10) also includes a flexible umbilical line (92) having a first end (94) configured to be coupled to the ceiling (90) of the operating room and a second end (96) coupled to the mobile support station (12). The umbilical line (92) is configured to route medical gases (80) and electrical lines (84) from a gas supply (78) and an electrical power supply (82), respectively, through the ceiling (90) and to the mobile support station (12).

A surgical table (10) includes a base (32), a vertical support member (34) extending vertically upwardly from the base (32), a frame (30) extending outwardly from the support member (34), and a mattress (38) supported by the frame (30) and positioned to lie above the frame (30). The mattress (38) is configured to support a patient (24) and has at least one bladder (122) configured to receive a medium. The surgical table (10) also includes a power pack (64) positioned to lie within the base (32) and configured to supply the medium to the mattress (38) to change the shape of the mattress (38).

bibliographic-data.invention-title: SYSTEME DE REGULATION THERMIQUE D'UN PATIENT

abstract.p: A system (10) for regulating a core body temperature of a person (12) includes a pressure applicator (20) configured to apply negative or cyclical positive pressure to a portion of the person (12) to vasodilate blood vessels of the person (12) within the portion, a heating device (22) configured to supply heat to the portion of the person (12), and a control apparatus (26). The control apparatus (26) is coupled to the heating device (22) and includes a controller (84) configured to vary the amount of heat supplied by the heating device (22).

The amount of heat supplied by the heating device (22) is varied in response to a difference in temperature between a preset temperature programmed into the controller (84) and an actual core body temperature of the patient (12) received by the controller from a temperature sensor on the person (12) such that the controller (84) maintains the actual core body temperature of the person (12) at substantially the preset temperature.

A system (10) for regulating a core body temperature of a person (12) includ es a pressure applicator (20) configured to apply negative or cyclical positive pressure to a portion of the person (12) to vasodilate blood vessels of the person (12) within the portion, a heating device (22) configured to supply heat to the portion of the person (12), and a control apparatus (26). The control apparatus (26) is coupled to the heating device (22) and includes a controller (84) configured to vary the amount of heat supplied by the heatin g device (22).

The amount of heat supplied by the heating device (22) is varie d in response to a difference in temperature between a preset temperature programmed into the controller (84) and an actual core body temperature of t he patient (12) received by the controller from a temperature sensor on the person (12) such that the controller (84) maintains the actual core body temperature of the person (12) at substantially the preset temperature.</SDO AB>

bibliographic-data.invention-title: SYSTEME DE REGULATION THERMIQUE D'UN PATIENT

abstract.p: A system (10) for regulating a core body temperature of a person (12) includ es a pressure applicator (20) configured to apply negative or cyclical positive pressure to a portion of the person (12) to vasodilate blood vessels of the person (12) within the portion, a heating device (22) configured to supply heat to the portion of the person (12), and a control apparatus (26). The control apparatus (26) is coupled to the heating device (22) and includes a controller (84) configured to vary the amount of heat supplied by the heatin g device (22).

The amount of heat supplied by the heating device (22) is varie d in response to a difference in temperature between a preset temperature programmed into the controller (84) and an actual core body temperature of t he patient (12) received by the controller from a temperature sensor on the person (12) such that the controller (84) maintains the actual core body temperature of the person (12) at substantially the preset temperature.</SDO AB>

A surgical table apparatus (10) includes a base (12), a pedestal (14), and an upper support frame (16) coupled to the pedestal (14). The upper support frame (16) includes a head frame section (20), a seat frame section (22), optional leg supports (24, 56, 79), and optional head supports (160, 200).

A surgical table apparatus (10) includes a base (12), a pedestal (14), and an upper support frame (16) coupled to the pedestal (14). The upper support frame (16) includes a head frame section (20), a seat frame section (22), optional leg supports (24, 56, 79), and optional head supports (160, 200).

bibliographic-data.invention-title: DISPOSITIF DE COMMANDE POUR EQUIPEMENT MEDICAL

abstract.p: A medical device controller (40) for controlling a surgical table having a controllable articulated frame (58) and a controllable surface (60) coupled to the frame is provided. The controller includes a handheld housing (114), a display (116), and a processor (106). The processor is configured to provide indicia on the display indicative of a user command to move the articulated frame to a desired frame configuration and to command the articulated frame to move to the desired frame configuration based on a user input. The processor is further configured to provide indicia on the display indicative of a user command to adjust the controllable surface to a desired surface configuration and to command the surface to adjust to the desired surface configuration based on a user input.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: DISPOSITIF DE COMMUNICATION ET D'ENTREE DE DONNEES

abstract.p: An integrated personal communcation and data entry device (10) includes a portable housing (12) and an internal controller (26) coupled to the housing. A paging device (30) and a voice recording device (28) are coupled to the controller. A system for paging members of a medical team is also provided. A paging signal dispatch system (40) includes a transmitter (42) configured to broadcast a paging signal to page a plurality of pagers (10, 30) simultaneously and a receiver (44) configured to receive page acknowledge return signals from the pagers. Each pager includes a receiver (30, 32) configured to receive the paging signal and a transmitter (30, 32) configured to send a page acknowledge signal. The pager is configured to send the page acknowedge signal based on an input to the user input device (18).

bibliographic-data.invention-title: APPAREIL DE SOUTIEN D'UN PATIENT CHAUFFANT APPAREIL DE SOUTIEN D'UN PATIENT CHAUFFANT
HEATED PATIENT SUPPORT APPARATUS HEATED PATIENT SUPPORT APPARATUS

abstract.p: An apparatus for warming a patient includes a patient support surface (26) having an outer cover (74) configured to contact the patient, an electricall y conductive fabric (70) located within the cover, and a controller electrical ly coupled to the conductive fabric to heat the electrically conductive fabric to a selected level.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: LIT POUVANT ETRE TOURNE FACE A TERRE LIT POUVANT ETRE TOURNE FACE A TERRE

abstract.p: A bed (10) includes a base (12), and a support assembly (22) coupled to the base (12). The support assembly includes first and second support arms (42, 44) located above the base (12). The bed (10) also includes a plurality of latch mechanisms (70, 72, 74) coupled to the first and second support arms (42, 44), and a patient support surface (50) configured to be coupled to the first and second support arms (42, 44) by the plurality of latch mechanisms (70, 72, 74). The patient support surface (50) is removable from the first a nd second support arms (42, 44) to permit transfer of a patient to and from the bed (10) on the patient support surface (50).

bibliographic-data.invention-title: APPAREIL DE POSITIONNEMENT D'UNE TABLE SUPPORT DE PATIENT
APPARATUS FOR POSITIONING A PATIENT-SUPPORT DECK

abstract.p: A patient-support apparatus (10) includes a base (12), a patient-support dec k (14) having a longitudinal length and a transverse width, and a deck- positioning assembly (16) coupling the patient-support deck (14) to the base (12). The patient-support deck (14) is supported with respect to the deck- positioning assembly (16) for longitudinal movement. The deck-positioning assembly (16) includes an actuator (76) having a first portion (78) and a second portion (80) that moves transversely relative to the first portion (78). The deck-positioning assembly (16) includes a transmission assembly (8 2) configured to convert transverse movement of the second portion (80) relativ e to the first portion (78) into longitudinal movement of the patient-support deck (14) relative to the base (12).

A patient support apparatus (310) comprises a base (312), a frame (316) coupled to the base (312), and a mattress (338) supported by the frame (316) and positioned to lie above the frame (316) to support a patient. A power pa ck (350, 372, 400) is pivotably coupled to one of the base (312), the frame (31 6) and the mattress (338) and is configured to supply a medium to the mattress (338).

bibliographic-data.invention-title: APPAREIL A ACTIONNEUR HYDRAULIQUE POUR TABLE CHIRURGICALE
HYDRAULIC ACTUATOR APPARATUS FOR A SURGICAL TABLE

abstract.p: A patient support (10) is provided comprising a support surface (16), a base (12), and a lift assembly (14) positioned to support the support surface (16 ) above the base (12). The lift assembly (14) includes an actuator (18) configured to adjust the height of the support surface (16). The actuator (1 8) includes a housing (26) formed to include first and second cylinders (82, 84 ). The actuator (18) further includes a first piston (60) positioned in the fir st cylinder (82) and a second piston (62) positioned in the second cylinder (84 ). The first piston (60) includes a first fluid passage (124) therein. The seco nd piston (62) includes a second fluid passage (126) therein.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: SUPPORT DE TETE POUR TABLE D'OPERATION
HEAD SECTION SUPPORT FOR A SURGICAL TABLE

abstract.p: A surgical table apparatus (10) is provided for supporting a patient before, during, or after a surgical procedure. The surgical table apparatus (10) includes a base (12) and a table top (16). The table top (16) includes a bod y support section (17) adapted to support the body of a patient and a head support section (18) adapted to support the head of a patient.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: SUPPORT DE LA PARTIE DES JAMBES POUR TABLE CHIRURGICALE
LEG SECTION SUPPORT FOR A SURGICAL TABLE

abstract.p: A surgical table apparatus (10) is provided for supporting a patient before, during, or after a surgical procedure. The surgical table apparatus (10) includes a base (12) and a table top (16). The table top (16) includes a bod y support section (17) adapted to support the body of a patient and a leg support section (26) adapted to support the legs of a patient.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: APPAREIL DE POSITIONNEMENT D'UN PLATEAU DE SUPPORT DE PATIENT
APPARATUS FOR POSITIONING A PATIENT-SUPPORT DECK

abstract.p: A patient-support apparatus (10) includes a base (12), a patient-support dec k (14), a deck-positioning assembly (16) coupling the patient-support deck (14 ) to the base (12), and a locking mechanism (300), the locking mechanism (300) having a first state to prevent longitudinal movement of the patient-support deck (14) relative to the base (12), and a second state to allow longitudina l movement of the patient-support deck (14) relative to the base (12).

abstract.p: A surgical table (10) includes a base (32), a vertical support member (34) extending vertically upwardly from the base (32), a frame (30) extending outwardly from the support member (34), and a mattress (38) supported by the frame (30) and positioned to lie above the frame (30). The mattress (38) is configured to support a patient (24) and has at least one bladder (122) configured to receive a medium. The surgical table (10) includes a power pack (64) positioned to lie within the base (32) and configured to supply the medium to the mattress (38) to change the shape of the mattress (38). <IMAGE>

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Dispositif de commande pour équipement médical

abstract.p: A medical device controller (40) for controlling a surgical table having a controllable articulated frame (58) and a controllable surface (60) coupled to the frame is provided. The controller includes a handheld housing (114), a display (116), and a processor (106). The processor is configured to provide indicia on the display indicative of a user command to move the articulated frame to a desired frame configuration and to command the articulated frame to move to the desired frame configuration based on a user input. The processor is further configured to provide indicia on the display indicative of a user command to adjust the controllable surface to a desired surface configuration and to command the surface to adjust to the desired surface configuration based on a user input. <IMAGE>

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Dispositif de commande pour équipement médical

abstract.p: A surgical table includes a base, a vertical support member extending vertically upwardly from the base, a frame extending outwardly from the support member, and a mattress supported by the frame and positioned to lie above the frame. The mattress is configured to support a patient and has at least one bladder configured to receive a medium. The surgical table also includes a power pack positioned to lie within the base and configured to supply the medium to the mattress to change the shape of the mattress.

A surgical support apparatus includes a mobile support station configured to receive medical equipment thereon. The mobile support station includes at least one gas outlet and at least one electrical outlet for supplying gas and electricity to an operating room. The apparatus also includes a flexible umbilical line having a first end coupled to the mobile support station and a second end configured to be coupled to a ceiling of the operating room. The umbilical line is configured to route medical gases and electrical lines from a gas supply and an electrical power supply, respectively, through the ceiling and to the mobile support station.

A system for regulating a core body temperature of a person includes a pressure applicator configured to apply negative or cyclical positive pressure to a portion of the person to vasodilate blood vessels of the person within the portion, a heating device configured to supply heat to the portion of the person, and a control apparatus. The control apparatus is coupled to the heating device and includes a controller configured to vary the amount of heat supplied by the heating device. The amount of heat supplied by the heating device is varied in response to a difference in temperature between a preset temperature programmed into the controller and an actual core body temperature of the patient received by the controller from a temperature sensor on the person such that the controller maintains the actual core body temperature of the person at substantially the preset temperature.

- Hausted, "Products for Head and Neck Surgery", date unknown, 4 pages

abstract.p: A surgical table apparatus includes a base, a pedestal, and an upper support frame coupled to the pedestal. The upper support frame includes a head frame section, a seat frame section, optional leg supports, and optional head supports.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Apparatus for positioning a patient-support deck

abstract.p: A patient-support apparatus that comprises a base, a patient-support deck having a longitudinal length and a transverse width, and a deck-positioning assembly coupling the patient-support deck to the base. The patient-support deck is supported with respect to the deck-positioning assembly for longitudinal movement. The deck-positioning assembly includes an actuator having a first portion and a second portion that moves transversely relative to the first portion. The deck-positioning assembly includes a transmission assembly configured to convert transverse movement of the second portion relative to the first portion into longitudinal movement of the patient-support deck relative to the base.

A surgical table apparatus includes a base and an upper support frame coupled to the base to support a person. The surgical table apparatus also includes a head support coupled to the upper support frame to support the person's head.

nplcit.text: - Midmark Corporation, 547 SLS.TM. brochure, 4 pages, Feb. 1998
- Hausted, "Models 878, 678 & 675 Uni-Care.RTM. Mobile Surgical Stretcher", date unknown, 1 page
- Koenigkramer Dentsply. "Reliance.RTM. M-701 Surgical Stretcher", date unknown, 2 pages
- Hausted, "Products for Head and Neck Surgery", date unknown, 4 pages

abstract.p: A surgical table apparatus includes a base and an upper support frame coupled to the base to support a person. The surgical table apparatus also includes a head support coupled to the upper support frame to support the person's head.

A patient support apparatus comprises a base, a frame coupled to the base, and a mattress located on the frame to support a patient. The apparatus also includes a display and a controller coupled to the display. The controller is configured to provide a menu on the display of a plurality of predefined configurations of the frame and mattress, and the processor is configured to command the frame and mattress to move to a selected one of the plurality of predefined configurations based on a user input.

A surgical table apparatus includes a base and an upper support frame coupled to the base to support a person. The surgical table apparatus also includes a pair of foot support portions coupled to the upper support frame to support the person's feet.

nplcit.text: - Hausted, "Products for Head and Neck Surgery", date unknown, 4 pages

abstract.p: A surgical table apparatus includes a base and an upper support frame coupled to the base to support a person. The surgical table apparatus also includes a pair of foot support portions coupled to the upper support frame to support the person's feet.

A patient support apparatus includes a base, a frame coupled to the base, and a mattress supported by the frame and positioned to lie above the frame to support a patient. The mattress has at least one bladder configured to receive a medium. The apparatus also includes a power pack pivotably coupled to and supported by one of the base, the frame and the mattress and configured to supply the medium to the at least one bladder of the mattress.

A bed (10) includes a base (12), and a support assembly (22) coupled to the base (12). The support assembly includes first and second support arms (42, 44) located above the base (12). The bed (10) also includes a plurality of latch mechanisms (70, 72, 74) coupled to the first and second support arms (42, 44), and a patient support surface (50) configured to be coupled to the first and second support arms (42, 44) by the plurality of latch mechanisms (70, 72, 74). The patient support surface (50) is removable from the first and second support arms (42, 44) to permit transfer of a patient to and from the bed (10) on the patient support surface (50).

A patient support system comprises an articulated frame having a plurality of segments, a frame controller coupled to the frame to move at least one of the segments, a mattress having at least one chamber, a mattress controller coupled to the mattress to control an amount of fluid in the at least one chamber, and a user interface controller configured to send control signals to the frame controller and to the mattress controller.

A patient support system comprises an articulated frame having a plurality of segments, a frame controller coupled to the frame to move at least one of the segments, a mattress having at least one chamber, a mattress controller coupled to the mattress to control an amount of fluid in the at least one chamber, and a user interface controller configured to send control signals to the frame controller and to the mattress controller.
